lines.content: Kroissant is built in collaboration of me, the human, and my AI friend, Gemini 3 Pro.
Thus, this doc serve as a diary of how Gemini help me in baking Kroissant.
- Very helpeful in creating interesting pun wording for Kroissant's messages.
- Help me a ton in adding exceptions to exsisting Kroissant Class.
- Help create TaskManager when given a prompt that I want "a file that handle saving, loading, and updating tasks".
- Refactor Kroissant into different classes for A-MoreOOP.
- Help me in creating tests for all the classes (A-JUnit).
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Kroissant_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Kroissant.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Kroissant.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* Represents the available commands in the Kroissant application.
LIST, MARK, UNMARK, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, FIND, BYE
* Represents a task with a deadline (due date and time).
* Supports multiple date/time input formats and displays in a standardized
private static final DateTimeFormatter[] INPUT_FORMATS = new DateTimeFormatter[]{
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HH:mm");

* @param date  Deadline in one of the supported formats (yyyy-MM-dd HHmm,
* @throws IllegalArgumentException If the date format is invalid.
throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid date format. Please use dd/MM/yyyy HHmm (e.g., 2/12/2019 1800)");

* @param to    End time of the event.

* Represents the main chatbot application for task management.

* @param ui      UI instance for displaying messages.
* @param storage Storage instance for saving tasks.
* @return True if exit command is received, false otherwise.
* @throws KroissantException If the command is invalid or execution fails.

* Handles loading and saving of tasks to a file using serialization.

* Represents a todo task without any date or time constraints.
* Handles all user interface interactions including displaying messages and
System.out.println("  Rise and Shine! I'm Kroissant.");
System.out.println("  What ingredients are we mixing today?");
System.out.println("  Let's get this bread again soon!");
* Reads a command from the user.
System.out.println("  OH CRUMBS!!! Error loading tasks. Starting with an empty list.");
* Displays a message confirming that a task has been added.
* @param task      The task that was added.
* @param taskCount Total number of tasks after adding.
public void showTaskAdded(Task task, int taskCount) {
System.out.println("  Okay, I've folded this into the dough:");
System.out.println("  Now you have " + taskCount + " pastries baking in the list!");
* Displays a message confirming that a task has been deleted.
* @param task      The task that was deleted.
* @param taskCount Total number of tasks after deletion.
public void showTaskDeleted(Task task, int taskCount) {
System.out.println("  Noted. This one out the oven:");
System.out.println("  Now you have " + taskCount + " pastries baking in the list!");
System.out.println("  Chef's kiss! This task is golden brown and fully baked:");
System.out.println("  Oops, looks a bit doughy inside. Putting it back in the oven:");
* Displays all tasks in the task list.

System.out.println("  The oven is empty! Time to get kneading.");
System.out.println("  Here are the pastries rising in your list:");
System.out.println("  No matching pastries found in the oven!");
System.out.println("  Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
boolean isExit = Parser.parseAndExecute("bye", taskList, ui, storage);
boolean isExit = Parser.parseAndExecute("todo buy milk", taskList, ui, storage);
() -> Parser.parseAndExecute("deadline submit report", taskList, ui, storage));
assertThrows(KroissantException.class, () -> Parser.parseAndExecute("event meeting", taskList, ui, storage));
assertThrows(KroissantException.class, () -> Parser.parseAndExecute("mark abc", taskList, ui, storage));
boolean isExit = Parser.parseAndExecute("list", taskList, ui, storage);
Parser.parseAndExecute("TODO buy milk", taskList, ui, storage);
Todo todo = new Todo("Buy milk & bread @ store");
assertEquals("[T][ ] Buy milk & bread @ store", todo.toString());
